name: afastidioushat
text: I love this strip so much.

name: doctorother
text: Roast Beef is incredibly considerate.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I hope you're giving him a hug, Chris. The cat does not need more abuse.

name: lateadopter
text: The answer's in the alt-text.  (Tellumo posted it below.)

name: ohmygooses
text: A comment left by ohmygooses was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by robbingdog, mistlethrush, fmercury)

name: zem
text: A comment left by zem was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ohmygooses, DomainAvailable, SotiCoto)

name: mugi
text: It all makes perfect sense now.

name: charchar
text: Better than the rule socal-b.99.1 generation

name: charchar
text: social, dammit, SOCIAL

name: notgodot
text: A comment left by notgodot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sevenslashfour, dizneedave, TPman90, RedMange, bucklemyshoe, mugi, Footbullet)

name: all-star951
text: I like xkcd. I guess whatever floats your boat, though. I didn't give you a lame for freedom of expression.

name: redmange
text: A comment left by redmange was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by MelloClello, NotGodot, even_deader, Zem)

name: carlyle
text: "To hell" with freedom of expression? You couldn't lame him WITHOUT freedom of expression

name: redmange
text: Don't you tell me what I can and cannot do on the internet good sir.  On my honor I will hit this monitor so hard you will feel it in your testes upon your sixty-seventh birthday.

name: carlyle
text: Well, sure, I've got time.

name: narwhalrus
text: Shit, man, I'm going to use this at every opportunity. You mind?

name: redmange
text:
You can feel free, comedy is a product of the people.

On an unrelated note, I have come to the conclusion, in the interim of when I first made the above comments, that XKCD -is- a bad comic. I have reallocated chubbies to atone for my past sins.

name: carlyle
text: Wait, what-- Oh! Xkcd was what this whole thread was about! Now I remember!

name: soticoto
text:
Just as well.
If I still had the power to lame, I would have done so for your actions in this comment-chain.
Alas my kneecapping days are over... so I shall simply chubb that one comment for your belated realisation that xkcd is, in a word, overrated.

name: snowman
text: I can't figure out why Onstad refers to himself in third person in the alt-text.  Maybe he has a hard time expressing love for his characters.

name: professorhazard
text: Ray loves you, too.

name: hexjumper
text: The last panel sells the whole thing, turning it from Roast Beef doing his thing into something larger.

name: insomnia
text: The lack of speech in the last panel is what makes this strip pure gold.

name: lastlarf
text: I adore this strip. It's sweet. Achewood shows it's soft underbelly.

name: jhunter
text: and now we move in for the kill

name: cpnglxynchos
text: quick as a limpet!

name: mr_pete
text: It is okay, Beef. Onstad was just now saying: "Man, I could do for an Asahi for later."

name: catachresis
text: It is the perfect counterpoint to the previous strip. Perfect, perfect, perfect.

name: tellumo
text: he loves the little cat Roast Beef

name: dtuba
text: We do, too.

name: chaesar
text: I don't know what Onstad looks like, but that last panel, he's drawn himself built like a goddamn linebacker.

name: saurkraus
text: All that sketching has given his guns some really good definition.

name: rowboat
text: We know now that he's built more like a bowler.

name: dusty
text: This is a man who can walk through walls more easily than he can shift his momentum to use a door, provided that the door is not in his path and the wall is.

name: obvious
text: I like how the bottle is cat-sized.

name: kledermans
text: Must be airline Asahi.

name: epicurus
text: Last panel = heartwarming.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: I always thought it was a little creepy lookin' whenever Onstad picks up the cats, but I love how awkward they all get when they try to talk to him, like he's their tenth grade English teacher who they think is really cool but dont really know how to communicate with on an adult level yet, so just sort of blather uncomfortably.

name: achewoodno1fan
text: that is such beautiful way of putting it

name: nighttoad
text: yes. this analogy is perfect. i thought my tenth grade history teacher was an awesome guy, but basically the only thing i could ever think to say to him was, "oh man, mr. woods! i cannot believe that you like the band u2. you really should not like u2, they are a silly band. i'm sorry, i really don't mean to offend you... uhh, you like some good comic books, that is cool."

name: tombsgrave
text: Roast Beef is so cute in that last panel.

name: deancain29
text: Beef looks so...so... on the edge of freaking out when hes picked up

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
i think this is the closest we've gotten to seeing chris onstad's face.

nothin' but neck 'n' chin.

name: closefriend
text: From what I've seen, he reminds me of the Brawny guy for some reason.

name: talbain
text: THIS will change things

name: flynn
text: The Asahi is cat-sized.

name: tbtabby
text: The airlines buy all their liquor from Achewood.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: or just Ray.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ..FROM Ray.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: -=Ray=-

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i think i am done commenting on this strip now.

name: tekende
text: That'll do, pig. That'll do.

name: illusiono
text: This strip brings me such joy!  So much joy it was the first to inspire me to comment!  I promise these comments will get better with practice.

name: evolume
text: Onstad lifts with his knees which is in good, safe form.

name: _cheesekayke
text: this is the most adorable achewood strip I have ever seen.

name: heccibiggs
text: I have to disagree.

name: laserblade
text: As do I.

name: ibetso
text: This one gets a definite 5 from me because when Beef beats himself up about stuff like that, I want to pick him up too. That, or be a (cartoon) cat so I'd be able to say "Beef! Get out here. French me!"

name: spinynorman
text: I love the little cat Roast Beef.

name: tellumo
text: meeeee toooo.

name: jdhenry105
text: That is exactly the look on my cat's face when I go to pick her up.  Her name is Nightlife.

name: i_love_kate
text: A comment left by i_love_kate was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesler729, Tagrineth, Jeet, idsyen, cailetshadow, mattylite)

name: meowmix
text: Roast Beef's eyes in the last panel make this strip a 5 for me.

name: farqussus
text: Beef goes into rigor shock at the sudden intimacy.

name: mattylite
text: God I love this one. And this one . Something about when they get picked up is just so great. I love how the Onstads in the final panels of each are identical (at least it seems like to me, I always sucked at those damn find-the-difference things in Highlights magazine at the dentist's office).

name: terriblerobot
text: I am getting the weirdest sense of deja vu. Almost like I just read this exact post, 5 minutes ago. On the previous comic. Spoooky.

name: wharfrat
text: his eyes

name: kickstart
text: has Onstad ever said whether the cat characters are based or inspired by any real cats he has known?  It is nice to think of a sad grey cat called Roast Beef who gets picked up when he tries to buy a shirt on ebay.

name: homeskool
text:
Beef just looks so damn startled.

I like to think the phrase "hell he straight up just picked me up" is going through his head. <3

name: dipstikk
text: Roast Beef gets a hug for trying.

name: anticitizen
text: the love between Onstad and Roast Beef is the most tender love the world has ever seen ever.

name: rowboat
text: A tad one-sided. But tender, none the less.

name: carlyle
text: Last panel is... platinum?

name: puguglypress
text: its fuckin weird is what it is

name: zorbo
text: I love the way Roast Beef is nowhere near as opposed to the idea of being picked up as Ray is. He just wants some physical intimacy.

name: pocketsizepablo
text: roast beef needs some help big time but then again he wouldnt be roast beef if he wasnt massively deprressed and insecure
